original: In the scientific community, a new case of research misconduct has been drawing attention. A prominent researcher is alleged to have manipulated data and fabricated results. This misconduct seriously undermines scientific credibility, and many researchers and professional institutions have begun investigations. Such cases not only hinder scientific progress but may also provide the public with false information. Of particular, because the misconduct was uncovered in a field related to socially important research topics, its impact is likely to be significant. Going forward, new measures will be needed to ensure transparency.

undermine（動詞：弱体化させる：信頼や価値を徐々に損なう）／damage（動詞：損害を与える：物理的または感情的な損害を与える）で、undermineは徐々に信頼を低下させることを指します。
【参考】undermine trust（信頼を弱体化させる）／damage reputation（評判を損なう）
例: His actions undermine his authority. (彼の行動は彼の権威を弱体化させる。) / The storm damaged the building. (嵐が建物に損害を与えた。)

hinder（動詞：妨げる：進行を遅らせる、妨害する）／impede（動詞：妨げる：進行を妨げる）で、hinderは一般的な妨害、impedeはより強い妨害を意味します。

【誤りの説明】: 'Of particular' は 'In particular' にすべき。'In particular' は「特に」を意味し、特定の事柄を強調する際に使用します。
【参考】In particular（特に）／Especially（特に）
例: In particular, exercise is essential for health. (特に、運動は健康に不可欠です。) / She loves fruits, especially apples. (彼女は果物が好きで、特にリンゴが好きです。)

5文目: In particular, because the misconduct was uncovered in a field related to socially important research topics, its impact is likely to be significant.
（特に、今回の不正が発覚した分野は、社会的に重要な研究テーマに関連しているため、その影響は少なくないと考えられる。）
